availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ottoway B. Skaggs (Green County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John B. Skaggs. Married to Priscilla Thompson Skaggs. Father of Mary F. Skaggs, John A. Skaggs, and Edward I. Skaggs. Laborer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 13, 1861, to September 13, 1862. Died in military service in Madison County, Alabama, on September 13, 1862.

ab.bibl:
